intro: Chorizanthe laciniata, commonly known as the fringed galleta, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and dense clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant produces distinctive, finely toothed leaves that are often covered in a layer of fine hairs. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in sandy or gravelly soils. Chorizanthe laciniata is adapted to withstand drought and is an important component of desert ecosystems.
